intro: Crassula subaphylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf crassula, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its compact, rounded growth habit. The plant features small, fleshy, oval-shaped leaves that are typically a pale green to blue-gray in color. It produces clusters of tiny, star-shaped flowers in shades of white or pink during the spring and summer months. Crassula subaphylla is well adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water and well-draining soil.
